text:
We had an amazing Chinese New Year dinner here, and the food was absolutely delicious! The standout dishes were the fresh oysters with garlic and chili, the marinated raw crabs, and the steamed crab with roe—each dish was bursting with flavor and beautifully prepared. The seafood was incredibly fresh, and the sauces complemented the natural sweetness perfectly.

The ambiance was warm and festive, making it a great place for a family gathering. A special shoutout to Lily for her exceptional service—she was attentive, friendly, and made sure we had everything we needed.

Highly recommend this place for modern Teochew cuisine lovers, and we’ll definitely be back again!

If you're looking for a place that serves mouthwatering Teochew fushion dishes, this spot is definitely worth a visit! Each bite is full of flavor and made with fresh ingredients.

The dessert Yam Paste芋泥 was particularly outstanding. The ambiance of the restaurant is cozy and inviting, making it an ideal place to enjoy a relaxing meal with friends or family. The restaurant manager is friendly too.Thanks for serving us fruits after meal.

I highly recommend checking out this gem at Frankel Avenue. It’s the perfect spot for a casual lunch or a special dinner out.

Oysters are fresh and good. Had the cold crabs which are good too. Cockles are good. Most of the dishes are good. We sat at the second level which is ok, just take note if you have people w mobility issues. Beer is acquired taste.

Came to shao for a gathering with my friends. The quality of the food here is fantastic. All the dishes we ordered were great and i could not decide on my favourite. Will definitely come again with my family.

Flavorful TeoChew dishes

Tables/chairs are packed a little close so expect a cosy atmosphere. Good for family gatherings and the like.

Do make reservations in advance. Car parking space is limited
